lines.content: Co-Pilot and ChatGPT used to help modify and generate Javadoc comments. While both were inaccurate
Co-Pilot was generally more helpful in generating comments for methods that were not yet implemented. I still
needed to review the code generated and modified by AI.
Co-Pilot was also helpful in writing redundant code, such as getters and setters.
It was especially helpful in automating writing the code for ParserTest which would have taken
much more effort as well time if I had to write it all by hand.
ChatGPT was helpful in understanding how to use certain methods as well as providing valualbe insight on how to
handle certain issues such how to print to the GUI when the file is not found.
> Built to remeber when the world tries to forget
Esm is built for you to focus on doing :saluting_face:
All you need to do is:
4. let it manage your tasks for you
- [X] Sort tasks alphabetically or by nearing deadline

Esm is a CLI chatbot for easy and quick managing of tasks. User can seamlessly add, delete, and view tasks as well as more features mentioned below.
Adds a task with a deadline to your list of tasks.
ESM confirms the item was added, echoes the task, and shows the size of the new list.
Adds a task to your list of tasks.
ESM confirms the item was added, echoes the task, and shows the size of the new list.
Adds a task with a start and end date to your list of tasks.
ESM confirms the item was added, echoes the task, and shows the size of the new list.
Marks a task in your list as done.
ESM confirms the task was marked done and outputs it.
Unmarks a done task in your list.
ESM confirms the task was unmarked and outputs it.
Deletes a task from your list.
ESM confirms the task was deleted done and outputs it.
Shows the list of all your tasks.
Shows the list of all possible commands you can use and correct format to use them
Finds a task within your list and returns a list of all found matches
* Full phrase is searchec, no partial matches are returned
ESM shows a list of all possible matches or "No such task was found" if no matches were made.
Sorts the list in your task alphabetically or according to nearing deadline first.
* Use d for sorting according to nearest deadline.
****NOTE**** using sort doesn't modify the saved list!
Data is saved in the hard disk only after you enter the bye command. Force quits will lose any progress made.

+ "To add a deadline task - deadline <name/info> /by <date in YYYY-MM-DD\n"
+ "To add an event task - event <name/info> / <start date> / <end date>\n"

+ "To unmark a task that was done - unmark <index of task>\n"
+ "To delete a task - delete <index of task>\n"
+ "To see a list of all tasks - list\n"
+ "To find a task - find <name/info of task>\n"
+ "To get a sorted list - sort <a> /ascending alphabetical order) or/ d /for ascending deadline/>\n";

* Unit tests for the Parser class.
* Tests the parseIndex method when the input contains the index of the task to be marked.
* Tests the parseIndex method when the input does not contain a valid index.
* Tests the parseIndex method when the input contains more than one index.
assertTrue(e.getMessage().contains("Thou provided more input than expected"));
* Tests the parseIndex method when the input does not contain any index.
assertTrue(e.getMessage().contains("Thou did not provide task number"));
* Tests the getSavedTask method when the input line contains a saved ToDo task.
* Tets the getSavedTask method when the input line contains a saved Deadline task.
* Tests the getSavedTask method when the input line contains a saved Event task.
* Tests the getSavedTask method when the input line does not contain a valid task type.
* Test the getSavedTask method when the input line is empty.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Deadline command.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Event command.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid ToDo command.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Mark command.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Unmark command.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Delete command.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Find command.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Sort command with alphabetical order.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Sort command with nearing deadline order.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid List command.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Bye command.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is empty.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is an unknown string.
* Tests the parseInput method when the input is a valid Help command.

assertTrue(e.getMessage().contains("Thoust should try to repeat what you want correctly, see <help>"));

* Unit tests for the Storage class.
* Tests that loadFile returns an empty list when the file does not exist yet.
* Tests that loadFile loads the correct list when the file is present.
* Tests that saveFile correctly saves the list to the file.
* Unit tests for the TaskList class.
* Tests that the markTask method correctly marks the task at the specified index as done.
* Tests that the unmarkTask method correctly unmarks the task at the specified index as not done.
* Tests that removeTask on an empty list returns null and does not remove anything.
* Tests that getSize returns the correct size of the task list.
* Tests that removeTask correctly removes a task from a populated list.
* Tests that removeTask with an invalid index does not remove any task.
* Tests that addTask correctly adds a task.
* Tests that getTask returns the correct task at a valid index.
* Tests that getTask returns null when accessing an invalid index.
* Tests that getList returns the underlying task list.
* Tests that printList correctly returns the expected output the tasks in the list.
* Tests that printList correctly outputs a message when the task list is empty.
* Tests that findTask correctly finds a task that is present in a non-empty list.
* Tests that findTask returns an empty list when the task is not found in a non-empty list.
* Tests that findTask returns an empty list when the provided list to search through is empty.
* Tests that sortList correctly sorts the list by nearing deadline.
* Tests that sortList correctly sorts the list alphabetically by name.
* Tests that sortList with an empty list returns an empty list.
